decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing no: OS 100042766 (Site Location Plan) Dated 22-August 2024 
Drawing no:( Block Plan) Dated 22-August 2024 
Drawing no: Sht - 04 - E(Existing Ground Floor Plan) Dated 22-August 2024 
Drawing no: Sheet 13 (Proposed First Floor Plan) Dated 22-August 2024 
Drawing no: (Proposed Front Elevation AA Plan) Dated 22-August 2024 
Drawing no: (Proposed Rear Elevation BB Plan) Dated 22-August 2024 
Drawing no: (Proposed Loft Floor Plan Amended) Dated 08 October 2024 
Drawing no:(Proposed Roof Plan) Dated 22-August 2024  
Drawing no: (Proposed Section CC Plan Amended) Dated 08 October 2024   
Site Photographs received on 09th May 2024

Condition : 4 - The development is only just within Permitted Development tolerances in terms of 39.6 cubic metres volume. You are advised to complete the development in full accordance with the Amended plans, as if the development is larger than that covered by this Certificate a breach of planning control could result.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was Advised to Amend the Roof Plans retaining the Existing Ridge without raising the ridge of the existing Roof and provide Amended Plans with the Dormer Volume Calculations .
   ii) The application was acceptable with the Amended Plans submitted as required. and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
   .
